item.title: Weeknotes: Orienting â€” Week 49, 2024
item.description: This week felt considerably more normal than last week. Maybe the routine got me somewhere. Maybe itâ€™s just the jet lag having worn off. Maybe itâ€™s the nature of the life-admin changing. Maybe itâ€™s something elseâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This week felt considerably more normal than last week. Maybe the routine got me somewhere. Maybe itâ€™s just the jet lag having worn off. Maybe itâ€™s the nature of the life-admin changing. Maybe itâ€™s something else entirely.

  • This week in data:

    • ğŸ“¼ Training videos watched: 5 hours
    • ğŸŒ¯ Team lunches: 3
    • ğŸµ Oi Ocha consumed: 3.5 litres

  • Felt my first earthquake in yonks on Tuesday evening. Itâ€™s been a while (maybe 5 years?) so Iâ€™d forgotten how it feels. Intensity 1 so nobody else was even remotely fussed.

  • This was my first week at work, and Iâ€™m feeling the same sense of awe and wonder one does exploring any new world. Iâ€™m pretty excited!

  • Part of onboarding, or, I guess, being in a large company is needing an evergreen way of introducing yourself - and so one of my tasks involved writing a page about myself for an internal documentation hub. (It also includes a link to the about me page on this blog, which, is somewhat out of date - sorry!) Itâ€™s kind-of great, and reading others I realised that thereâ€™s lots to strike up conversations about.

    â€¦

item.title: Weeknotes: Not Unpacking â€” Week 48, 2024
item.description: This was one of these weird weeks where I didnâ€™t have much on - because it was my time off between two jobs. It was a bit like a staycation? But in a new place? Lots of life-admin. Where did I leave you? Ah yesâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This was one of these weird weeks where I didnâ€™t have much on - because it was my time off between two jobs. It was a bit like a staycation? But in a new place? Lots of life-admin.

  • Where did I leave you? Ah yes, watching Garfield on the plane. Tray table went up, we landed, we taxied and we disembarked. Now for the moment I was dreading: I went to the immigration counter for residents and was presented with my very own residence card. Phew - that was easy. And then both it and my passport were taken from me and I was asked to take a seat and wait. Uh-oh. After what felt like an eternity (a few minutes) both were handed back and I was allowed through: Iâ€™d given the wrong post-code.

  • Collected my bags, and met an agent who handed me my SIM card, keys, and a few other bits Iâ€™d need, before escorting me to a taxi. On the way I plug in my new SIM card on the way, message a few people to let them know Iâ€™ve landed. Before I knew it, weâ€™ve arrived and Iâ€™m standing alone on a brand new street with two suitcases, a backpack and some documents to keep me company. And I now understand the confusion at border control: There's no building by the name I've been given.

    â€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Not Packing â€” Week 47, 2024
item.description: This was my last week at the FT, something I kept very close to my chest. It surprised a few people. Truth be told it didnâ€™t really sink in for me until this week. I spent the entire week trying to remain composedâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• This was my last week at the FT, something I kept very close to my chest. It surprised a few people. Truth be told it didnâ€™t really sink in for me until this week. I spent the entire week trying to remain composed.

  • Why leave? The exit survey poses that question expectantly. Itâ€™s simple: Iâ€™m relocating and circumstances [editorâ€™s note: including but not only my age] made now the right time. Where to? Tokyo. Iâ€™ve wanted to do it since 2017, so, you know. Thatâ€™s why. This has been in the works for a hot minute.

  • This week in data:

    • ğŸ¥ª Pret eaten: 7 sandwiches
    • ğŸš¶ People who said they plan to visit Japan next year: 12
    • ğŸ¬ Movies watched: 6 films

  • Between packing and leaving a job. I began the week with a todo list as long as my arm...

  • Many people reached out to chat. Some wished me luck. Some said kind things. All of them â€” some of whom might be reading this â€” in reaching out made leaving just that little bit harder. Thank-you? But, really.

  • The most common question I got was â€œDo you speak any japanese?â€ to which I answered â€œå°‘ã—è©±ã›ã¾ã™â€, or, a little. The second most common question was â€œAre you packed yet?â€ to which I answered â€œNo, but thatâ€™s not the problem - itâ€™s getting rid of my furniture and all the other things Iâ€™m not packing!â€...

    â€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Red Arrow â€” Week 46, 2024
item.description: Hello from sunny Birmingham. The weather has been alternating between rain and grey all weekend. This week in data: Magazines issues thrown into a recycling bin: 37 Heartfelt emails sent: 9 Spent some time steelingâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Hello from sunny Birmingham. The weather has been alternating between rain and grey all weekend.
  • This week in data:
    • Magazines issues thrown into a recycling bin: 37
    • Heartfelt emails sent: 9
  • Spent some time steeling myself for a few conversations that I thought would be difficult. No, reader, they all went swimmingly well. Iâ€™m genuinely pleasantly surprised.
  • I got here in a van: Despite having multiple train lines from Birmingham to London, itâ€™s somehow still quicker to drive from my flat in London to my parents home in Birmingham. Or at least, it should have been: It took nearly 30 minutes to drive down Putney High Street alone. Sheesh.
  • Bluesky is really popping off huh.
  • L helped me with some more chores. Later we played some music, first semi-seriously and later after giving up just committed some crimes with my apparently now broken mixer.
  • Despite the (painful, at least to me) mistakes that was still a pretty technically advanced set and I'm pretty proud of how far I've come since picking DJing back up in 2020. It's such a fun hobby. And it's a very different, really intimate â€” and almost therapeuticâ€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Thirty Hours â€” Week 45, 2024
item.description: Much of my week was spent with the US elections, making sure that reporting worked as well as it could. Looking after the systems and tools telling the news makes it easier to detach from the news. However it isnâ€™tâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Much of my week was spent with the US elections, making sure that reporting worked as well as it could. Looking after the systems and tools telling the news makes it easier to detach from the news. However it isnâ€™t always easy to stay detached: Thatâ€™s the rub.

  • This week in data:

    • ğŸ§¦ Sponsored socks worn: 3 pairs.
    • ğŸ– Meat consumed: 0 grams.
    • ğŸ“§ Emails deleted: 6251 threads.

  • Bluesky is now my primary social media network. If you donâ€™t already, give me a follow!

  • Coverage of the US election took up the entirety of the first few days of the week, with Tuesday and Wednesday turning into something of an all-nighter. We were prepared for a several-day marathon, but it quickly became clear that this was much shorter (yet faster) sprint instead.

  • It all went rather smoothly. We got some delightful feedback from some readers â€” and several million page-views in the first day. Thatâ€™s the upside, or, a â€œreason to be cheerfulâ€ as GC would put it.

  • A lot can change in thirty hours: There's now a lot of commentary floating around, and with the exception of a few interesting anecdotes such as The Bronx being the biggest swing, I'm mostly blocking it out. Especially the hit-pieces rushing to apportion some blame. Mostly those, actually. It isn't that I'm apolitical â€” I am not â€” or even that I want this blog to be: I am just still processing, as I'm sure many others are too.

    â€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Plant-Based Nuggets â€” Week 44, 2024
item.description: Spent a lot of the week helping with various aspects of US election coverage next week. Some assorted tasks and a real deep-dive into web performance and maps, the latter which Iâ€™ve not done much work with beforeâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Spent a lot of the week helping with various aspects of US election coverage next week. Some assorted tasks and a real deep-dive into web performance and maps, the latter which Iâ€™ve not done much work with before. Managed to get a 75% performance improvement in a crucial area which Iâ€™m quite happy with.
  • This week in numbers:
    • Ebay listings created: 2
    • Red-meat consumed: 0 grams
    • Headphones thrown away: 1.5 pairs
  • Starting to like React Hooks. Yeah, Iâ€™ve not been thrilled at them until now.
  • LF and I went to Baronâ€™s Bites, which was a League of Legends pop-up/takeover of Butchies. Was it worth the twenty-minute queue? No. But I got a badge, which I gave away later that same evening. I paid Â£11 for their finest plant-based nuggets which started out strong and ended in regret. The queue seemed friendly.
  • The Apple Intelligence update dropped. Um. Itâ€™s not great, is it? Hereâ€™s a doozy: â€œCow sighting; desperate for cow manureâ€. Hereâ€™s another: â€œOne soup through a straw, deemedâ€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Restoring â€” Week 43, 2024
item.description: Low energy start to the week: I had Monday off, and ended up taking part of Tuesday off too. Iâ€™ve been feeling a little under the weather, but I think now slowly on the mend. This week in data: Individual shoes thrownâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Low energy start to the week: I had Monday off, and ended up taking part of Tuesday off too. Iâ€™ve been feeling a little under the weather, but I think now slowly on the mend.

  • This week in data:

    • Individual shoes thrown away: 5
    • How long it took me to realise the clocks went back: 18 hours
    • Total of all payments made in cash: Â£17

  • I have glasses now, sort-of. I can see totally fine without them - but over the years Iâ€™ve developed an astigmatism and so theyâ€™re really helping with situations with contrasting bright lights. Still figuring out when to wear them.

  • In very exciting work news, CCC â€” which Iâ€™ve here and there since its kick-off last April â€” is now finally live, debuted this week by Joanna Kaoâ€™s excellent article on AI-assisted accessibility tooling, and how they arenâ€™t what they seem. It was a monumental effort getting there and the change seems subtle, but is profound: Previously an article with inline functionality like that would not work on the main website or app. The same is true of most news organisations and so I'm very excited to see where this capability goes!

    â€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Relith â€” Week 42, 2024
item.description: Saw the kingâ€™s official transport going through the City of London again. Thereâ€™s nothing too interesting for me to say about it but it felt noteworthy at the time. Some tourists mightâ€™ve been impressed, but livingâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Saw the kingâ€™s official transport going through the City of London again. Thereâ€™s nothing too interesting for me to say about it but it felt noteworthy at the time. Some tourists mightâ€™ve been impressed, but living here Iâ€™ve lost that magic.
  • This week in numbers:
    • ğŸ•¸ï¸ Domains purchased: 2
    • ğŸ“ Phone-calls: 22
    • ğŸ² Soup consumed: 2.2L
  • Had a few conversations this week which I really enjoyed. I mixed a few different tools/techniques which let me keep them short and structured: Think coaching blended with the 5-whys, fuelled by active note-taking.
  • On my backburner is the general problem of, â€œHow to orchestrate/instrument R?â€ The closest Iâ€™ve come is the openmetrics library, but what I really want is to see where a pipeline might be failing.
  • If youâ€™re ever wondering if you should sort your data client-side or server-side, the answer is: both! A comparison sort (A>B, or: Array.sort((a,b) => (b-a))) has linear complexity so is cheap to run client-side if data is already sorted, and itâ€™s a good defence mechanismâ€¦

item.title: Weeknotes: Bruising â€” Week 41, 2024
item.description: Short week this week: In part because of last week it started on Tuesday morning, and in another part because my weekend got capped. :( This week in numbers: ğŸŒ¿ Plant-based dinners: 3/6 ğŸšï¸ Missed buttdials from DJs:â€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Short week this week: In part because of last week it started on Tuesday morning, and in another part because my weekend got capped. :(

  • This week in numbers:

    • ğŸŒ¿ Plant-based dinners: 3/6
    • ğŸšï¸ Missed buttdials from DJs: 2
    • ğŸ’‰ Cannulas worn: 2

  • Last weekâ€™s terrible eating and drinking led me this week to notch up my New Health Century. I ate mostly vegetables this week. Tim Spector would be proud.

  • I thought I had a week for the assignment I got last week, it turns out that no, I had until EOP Tuesday. I'd already set-up a meeting with the most important peer to bounce ideas off, so I put together a scratch document with a lot of messy notes outlining exactly which technical problems underpinned the challenge we'd been set, and transposed them into some much clearer bullet-points in the shared, working document. Got a spot edit, with very minor corrections, and some good feedback about it the following day so I'm pretty chuffed with that.

  • Our CTO hosted a remote-first "senior technology staff get-together" this week which brought many of us together informally to chat about various topics. I actually loved the chance to connect with colleagues I hadn't properly spoken to before, or hadn't worked with/seen in ages. Real highlight of the week - and better yet she has encouraged us to use the format if we like it.

    â€¦

Read the full post here...

item.title: Weeknotes: Banging â€” Week 40, 2024
item.description: Work was a bit of a blur this week. Spent some time polishing a Tech-Design-Doc which doubled as a check-list: Feedback was (consistently) to split the two. Spent some time talking about support coverage over the USâ€¦
item.dc:creator: alex
item.content:encoded:
• Work was a bit of a blur this week. Spent some time polishing a Tech-Design-Doc which doubled as a check-list: Feedback was (consistently) to split the two. Spent some time talking about support coverage over the US election. Spent some time doing a rewrite of a document about ES.
  • This week in numbers:
    • ğŸš— Miles in a car: 354
    • ğŸ•º Steps taken on a dance-floor: 64153
    • ğŸ–ï¸ Beaches seen: 1
    • ğŸ¶ Highest BPM: 200
  • Monday marked MTâ€™s last day at the FT. :(
  • Wednesday evening I was joined by M on a mission to buy PJs (thx Uniqlo) followed by dinner and a slow walk up to Guy Ritchieâ€™s pub (which gave major old-man boozer vibes).
  • Thursday I left the house (after a last-minute assignment/call), and went to Paddington station via The Cockpit. Why? Meeting LF to catch a train to Reading. Why? Road-trip from there to Skegness in the morning. We met up with JL and grabbed a â€˜spoons dinner and siren chaser.
  • Friday we drove up to Skegness, picking up a McDs brekkie and LM on the way. There was aâ€¦
